oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ASSESSMENT OF LONG-TERM WIND AND WAVE TRENDS IN THE BLACK SEA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Islek, Fulya
Yuksel, Yalcin
Sahin, Cihan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The wind and wave climate over the Black Sea were investigated by providing extensive datasets covering the last 40 years (1979-2018). Wind characteristics over the Black Sea were evaluated by using two well-known wind fields (i.e., ECMWF ERA-Interim and NCEP/CFSR). Wave simulations were generated from the MIKE 21 SW model forcing with two wind datasets. The possible effect of the long-term variability on the wind and wave characteristics over the Black Sea was discussed in the context of climate change.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36v (2020): Proceedings of virtual Conference on Coastal Engineering, 2020; waves.5
